summary: The document is a declassified CIA intelligence information cable from January 19, 1965, focusing on the financial aspects of Cuban armed forces mobilization during 1964 and early 1965. It provides specific figures on the cost per man per day and total expenses for a 32-day mobilization period, alongside notes on the Cuban government's economization efforts. The reliability of the source, a high-ranking Cuban official, is emphasized, along with the document's classification details.
key_findings: The estimated cost of mobilization per man per day was $5.1 pesos in 1964.
A 32-day mobilization involving 51,828 men in spring 1964 cost the Ministry of the Armed Forces at least $8,176,329 pesos.
Efforts by the Castro government to economize during the mobilization are noted.
The information comes from a highly placed Cuban official, deemed reliable since February 1964.
